channel.title: CVE Feed for ECOA -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ECOA -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-41292|2024-09-17T03:32:30.239Z -- ecoa -- ecs%20router%20controller%20ecs%20%28flash%29
item.description: ECOA BAS controller suffers from an authentication bypass vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker through cookie poisoning can remotely bypass authentication and disclose sensitive information and circumvent physical access controls in smart homes and buildings and manipulate HVAC.

item.title: CVE-2021-41296|2024-09-17T03:17:33.292Z -- ecoa -- ecs%20router%20controller%20ecs%20%28flash%29
item.description: ECOA BAS controller uses weak set of default administrative credentials that can be easily guessed in remote password attacks and gain full control of the system.

item.title: CVE-2021-41295|2024-09-17T00:52:20.343Z -- ecoa -- ecs%20router%20controller%20ecs%20%28flash%29
item.description: ECOA BAS controller has a Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability, thus authenticated attacker can remotely place a forged request at a malicious web page and execute CRUD commands (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to perform arbitrary operations in the system.

item.title: CVE-2021-41294|2024-09-17T03:53:41.840Z -- ecoa -- ecs%20router%20controller%20ecs%20%28flash%29
item.description: ECOA BAS controller suffers from a path traversal vulnerability, causing arbitrary files deletion. Using the specific GET parameter, unauthenticated attackers can remotely delete arbitrary files on the affected device and cause denial of service scenario.
